data.text: @NewTimesRwanda There is no greater joy than having financial stability and a life free of debts, that’s why I keep tweeting about @Hithermann123 it has been a pleasure collaborating with you...there is no other way I can show my appreciation other than tweeting the good deed you have done

@NewTimesRwanda There is no greater joy than having financial stability and a life free of debts, that’s why I keep tweeting about @Hithermann123 it has been a pleasure collaborating with you...there is no other way I can show my appreciation other than tweeting the good deed you have done

Arafat Balunywa, a Ugandan truck driver, transports goods from Nairobi to Kigali. He says he is glad that he will take less time on the road, hence more goods. 

"I think I will get more and more jobs to bring in goods," he says. https://t.co/HYa2jgOrww
People coming from Uganda are also required a negative PCR test result and are provided with a rapid test on site for free. https://t.co/Zkgop56PfP
People coming from Uganda are also required a negative PCR test result and are provided with a rapid test on site for free. https://t.co/PYALspIS8p

However, Jean Claude Gatege, says that the negative PCR test requirement is a challenge because they were not informed of it before hand. 

"But I am sure this will be fixed soon," he added. https://t.co/7gGeChORyK

Jean Claude Gatege, who has not set foot on Ugandan soil in 7 years, says he is excited to finally be able to. "We are grateful for our leaders for this great step. Now we can meet our families again." https://t.co/Qb41vAicZS

This is the first group of people traveling by a Volcano Express bus at Gatuna border. Health care staff are on ground to help travelers who don't have a negative PCR test proof. 

They are also requested to show a proof of vaccination against the virus. https://t.co/89pa2oKuOa
